to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); only odd bits and pieces
a goose's footprint in the snow/vestiges of the past (idiom)/the fleeting nature of human life (idiom)

sentences.english: Ten years ago, his father and brother Yik Lok were attacked by the evil leopards.
sentences.chinese: 十年前其父与兄亦乐对抗魔豹时，父死于魔豹爪下。

sentences.english: The physiological function of the sterilant was also tested.
sentences.chinese: 本试验还对该药对长爪沙鼠的生理作用作了测试。

sentences.english: Feet down at the pastern are a serious fault.
sentences.chinese: 足爪在骹骨之下属于严重缺陷。

sentences.english: North American lemming having a white winter coat and some claws much enlarged.
sentences.chinese: 冬季为白色皮毛且一些爪非常大的北美洲旅鼠。

sentences.english: Dewclaws, if any on the hind legs may be removed.
sentences.chinese: 如果后腿有狼爪，可以切除。

sentences.english: One thinks of nature as "red in tooth and claw, " as the old saying goes.
sentences.chinese: 有人认为正如一句古话，自然界充斥着腥牙血爪。

sentences.english: Mr. White saved the paw from fire and wanted to have three wishes.
sentences.chinese: 怀特先生不顾朋友的警告，拿过了猴爪想许三个愿望。

sentences.english: A ratchet pawl locks or releases the ratchet slider.
sentences.chinese: 棘齿爪锁定或者释放所述棘齿滑块。

sentences.english: Double dewclaws are located on each rear leg.
sentences.chinese: 各二只狼爪位于二条腿的后方。

sentences.english: Both mothers were lying on their backs with their paws in the air.
sentences.chinese: 两个母狮都仰面而卧挥舞着狮爪。

sentences.english: A single or double dewclaw may be present on the rear feet.
sentences.chinese: 可能会在后足有单外翻爪或双外翻爪。

sentences.english: A single or double dewclaw may be present on the rear feet.
sentences.chinese: 可能会在后足有单外翻爪或双外翻爪。

sentences.english: All cats love fish but fear to wet their paws.
The universal chuck has only three jaws .
Feet - hare-shaped with feathering on the ends of the toes in the mature dog.
sentences.chinese: 足爪呈兔形足，成年狗的脚趾末端有饰毛。

sentences.english: Some people even cut pet's ear or claw or had pet's eyes gouged out.
sentences.chinese: 有些人甚至把宠物的耳朵或爪或宠物的眼睛剜了。

definition: the five fingers of one's hand
whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
